intro: Ardisia leptalea, commonly known as the slender arrowwood, is a species of evergreen shrub native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes many acid-loving plants. The plant features small, glossy, dark green leaves that are elliptical in shape. Its flowers are white and clustered in umbels, followed by bright red berries that are attractive to birds. Ardisia leptalea is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks.
